intro: Ermania kachrooi, commonly known as the Kachroo's ermania, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Pakistan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots that help it access underground water. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
